prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne five months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne five months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Will Stefan decide to follow his heart to me? If so, when will he communicate to me?

Please note that this reading requires 100% accuracy and honesty in interpretation, regardless of whether the aspects reveal positive or negative energies. The chart must be read exactly as it presents itself, without bias in either direction. If the aspects show negativity, that negativity will be revealed fully. If the aspects show positivity, that positivity will be revealed fully. There shall be no softening of negative aspects, nor any dampening of positive ones. The only acceptable outcome is to interpret precisely what the chart demonstrates through its aspects, houses, and planetary positions - be that wonderful, terrible, or anywhere in between. Complete accuracy to the chart's true message is the sole priority.

Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant's 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a comprehensive list of the horary chart data relevant to interpreting the question “Will Stefan decide to follow his heart to me? If so, when will he communicate to me?” using horary principles. In this chart, Melissa is represented by the Ascendant (5°44′ Cancer) and Stefan is indicated by the 9th house (the foreign connection), with its cusp beginning at 17° Aquarius (noting that the Sun is noted as contained here per the house system).

▮ Fundamental Planetary Positions
• Sun at 2°21′ Pisces
• Moon at 2°44′ Sagittarius
• Mercury at 11°35′ Pisces
• Venus at 9°11′ Aries
• Mars at 17°05′ Cancer (retrograde)
• Jupiter at 11°43′ Gemini
• Saturn at 19°41′ Pisces
• Uranus at 23°27′ Taurus
• Neptune at 28°35′ Pisces
• Pluto at 2°39′ Aquarius
• North Node at 28°48′ Pisces (retrograde)
• Chiron at 20°13′ Aries

▮ Key Angular and House Details
• Ascendant (Melissa): 5°44′ Cancer
• 9th House cusp (Stefan’s indicator as the foreign connection): 17° Aquarius (noting that the house contains the Sun by the provided data)
• Midheaven (MC): 11°36′ Pisces
• Imum Coeli (IC): 11°36′ Virgo

▮ Major Aspects (with reported orb sizes)
• Moon sextile Pluto – orb: 0°
• Jupiter square IC – orb: 0°
• Jupiter square MC – orb: 0°
• Mercury square Jupiter – orb: 0°
• Sun square Moon – orb: 0°
• MC opposition IC – orb: 0°
• Mercury opposition IC – orb: 0°
• Neptune conjunct North Node – orb: 0°
• Mercury conjunct MC – orb: 0°
• Venus sextile Jupiter – orb: 2°
• Mars trine Saturn – orb: 2°
• Mars square Chiron – orb: 3°
• Sun trine Ascendant – orb: 3°
• Pluto sextile North Node – orb: 4°
• Saturn sextile Uranus – orb: 4°
• Venus square Ascendant – orb: 4°
• Moon trine North Node – orb: 4°
• Moon trine Neptune – orb: 4°
• Uranus sextile Neptune – orb: 5°
• Ascendant sextile IC – orb: 6°
• Mars sextile IC – orb: 6°
• Mars sextile Uranus – orb: 6°
• Ascendant trine MC – orb: 6°
• Mars trine MC – orb: 6°
• Mercury trine Ascendant – orb: 6°
• Mercury trine Mars – orb: 6°
• Neptune square Ascendant – orb: 7°
• Moon trine Venus – orb: 7°
• Saturn opposition IC – orb: 8°
• Saturn conjunct MC – orb: 8°
• Mercury conjunct Saturn – orb: 8°

▮ Patterns and Configurations
• T-Square Pattern:
 – MC at 11° Pisces
 – Jupiter at 11° Gemini
 – IC at 11° Virgo
 – Mercury positioned at 11° Pisces
 (This configuration emphasizes tension between public (MC) and private (IC) realms, with Mercury as a connector.)

• Yod Configuration:
 – Apex at Pluto in 2° Aquarius
 – Supporting points: Ascendant in 5° Cancer and Moon in 2° Sagittarius
 (This yod suggests a destined but challenging dynamic requiring adjustment.)

• Cradle Configuration:
 – Saturn in 19° Pisces,
 – IC in 11° Virgo,
 – Mars in 17° Cancer, and
 – Uranus in 23° Taurus
 (This grouping will help determine stabilizing versus disruptive forces in communication and commitment.)

▮ Special Features and Additional Indicators
• The Moon is a last quarter moon, intensifying transitional energy.
• Dominance of the Water element among the inner planets, emphasizing emotional currents.
• Inner planets predominantly fall in non-Earth signs and show a mutable mode emphasis.
• The inner planets are mostly in the upper hemisphere, indicating prominence of public/external matters.
• Sun, Mercury, and Saturn are placed on or near the Midheaven (MC) with the IC on the opposite end (Nadir), highlighting a dynamic between external communication and internal concerns.
• The aspect of Sun trine Ascendant (orb 3°) directly links the higher-placed energy to the questioner (Melissa).
• The conjunction of Mercury with MC (orb 0°) underscores the urgency and immediacy of communication factors within the chart.

The data above comprises the full set of horary chart indicators relevant to the inquiry regarding Stefan’s decision and his communication timeline. Please document these details for further interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is the next step—a methodical breakdown of the chart’s indicators as they relate to your query (“Will Stefan decide to follow his heart to me? If so, when will he communicate to me?”). This analysis employs horary principles exclusively, based entirely on the provided chart details.

────────────────────────────
Step 2: Identification & Emphasis of Key Factors

• Communication Indicator – Mercury:
 – Mercury at 11°35′ Pisces is conjoined with the Midheaven (MC at 11°36′ Pisces). This direct contact underscores communication as a central theme.
 – The unanimity of Mercury’s placement in Pisces (a sign known for emotional intuition and boundary-blurring) stresses an urge for expression.

• Stefan’s Representation – 9th House (Foreign Connection):
 – The 9th House begins at 17° Aquarius. Within its domain, the Sun (though not a primary communication planet) is embedded, suggesting that Stefan’s involvement is colored by an unconventional or transformative influence.
 – Pluto at 2°39′ Aquarius in the chart further intensifies matters tied to the foreign/9th house influences; Pluto’s sextile to the North Node reinforces destiny-based change.

• Emotional Activation – The Moon:
 – The Moon, at 2°44′ Sagittarius, is in its waning phase (last quarter). This position fosters a sense of closure over old matters and indicates that decisive change may be delayed until the cycle completes.
 – Aspects from the Moon—such as its sextile with Pluto (orb 0°) and trines with the North Node (orb 4°) and Neptune (orb 4°)—hint at subtle emotional currents that can trigger transformation, though not forcefully.

• Action and Hesitation – Mars:
 – Mars is situated in 17° Cancer, retrograde, adding a layer of introspection and potential hesitation. Its role is mixed; while it can generate the drive for communication (especially given its sextile aspects to the MC and IC), its retrograde state indicates internal delays or ambivalence.
 – Mars’s square to Chiron (orb 3°) emphasizes a potential for wound-based responses or vulnerabilities that may interrupt direct action.

• T-Square Configuration:
 – The T-Square formed by the MC (11° Pisces), Jupiter (11° Gemini), and the IC (11° Virgo), with Mercury involved at 11° Pisces, frames a tension between public communication (MC) and personal or familial matters (IC).
 – This configuration suggests that while there is impetus for communication, competing priorities or conflicting energies (possibly linked to social and internal expectations) may slow its manifestation.

• Yod Formation:
 – The Yod, with Pluto as the apex (2° Aquarius) and the Ascendant (Melissa at 5°44′ Cancer) along with the Moon (2°44′ Sagittarius) as the supporting points, indicates a fated, if challenging, process.
 – This formation pressures the chart’s energies into a transformational course that might demand significant internal adjustments before outward expression occurs.

• Cradle Configuration:
 – The Cradle, involving Saturn (19° Pisces), the IC (11° Virgo), Mars (17° Cancer), and Uranus (23° Taurus), reflects a dynamic grouping that balances stabilization and sudden change.
 – Saturn’s sextile aspect to Uranus (orb 4°) implies that even though structures are in place, disruptive energy (particularly from Mars) can modify outcomes.

• Additional Interactions:
 – The strong Mercury–MC conjunction, in tandem with Mercury’s trines to both the Ascendant and Mars (orbs near 6°), augments the indicator of imminent communication, yet the zero orb of several aspects (e.g., Moon sextile Pluto, Sun square Moon) highlights that the energies are exactly aligned, leaving little room for ambiguity.
 – Neptune’s influence (28°35′ Pisces)—while conjoined by the North Node (0° orb)—adds an ethereal quality that may obscure precise timing but suggests that the message, when it comes, will carry weight beyond simple words.

────────────────────────────
Step 3: Consolidation of Timing Indicators

• Mercury is acting as the primary communicator. Its placement in Pisces directly upon the MC emphasizes that any messages from Stefan will likely be imbued with emotional or intuitive content rather than blunt logic.
 – Look to the activation of Mercury’s energy through its immediate transit cycles. Given Mercury’s current placement exactly conjoined to the MC, indications suggest an impulse toward communication is emerging now or very shortly.

• The last quarter Moon suggests that we are nearing the resolution of a cycle; completion of this phase often precedes decisive communication following a period of internal evaluation.

• Mars’s retrograde status implies that although the heart may be inclined, action is internally debated. The square to Chiron shows that unresolved wounds or hesitations may hold back direct expression. This factor points to some delay or internal processing before physical communication occurs.

• The T-square’s presence, with tensions centered on a pivotal degree (11°), further implies that while communication is intended, it might be impacted by ongoing conflicts between public persona (MC) and internal, personal resolve (IC).

────────────────────────────
Step 4: Summary of Methodological Extraction

• Melissa (Ascendant) stands poised in Cancer, facing emotional currents that demand clarity.
• Stefan, represented by the 9th house indicators and the presence of transformative Pluto in Aquarius, is influenced by fated and unconventional forces.
• Mercury’s precise conjunction with the MC pinpoints communication as the immediate mechanism through which Stefan’s heart might turn.

Below is the next step—a methodical breakdown of the chart’s indicators as they relate to your query (“Will Stefan decide to follow his heart to me? If so, when will he communicate to me?”). This analysis employs horary principles exclusively, based entirely on the provided chart details.

────────────────────────────
Step 2: Identification & Emphasis of Key Factors

• Communication Indicator – Mercury:
 – Mercury at 11°35′ Pisces is conjoined with the Midheaven (MC at 11°36′ Pisces). This direct contact underscores communication as a central theme.
 – The unanimity of Mercury’s placement in Pisces (a sign known for emotional intuition and boundary-blurring) stresses an urge for expression.

• Stefan’s Representation – 9th House (Foreign Connection):
 – The 9th House begins at 17° Aquarius. Within its domain, the Sun (though not a primary communication planet) is embedded, suggesting that Stefan’s involvement is colored by an unconventional or transformative influence.
 – Pluto at 2°39′ Aquarius in the chart further intensifies matters tied to the foreign/9th house influences; Pluto’s sextile to the North Node reinforces destiny-based change.

• Emotional Activation – The Moon:
 – The Moon, at 2°44′ Sagittarius, is in its waning phase (last quarter). This position fosters a sense of closure over old matters and indicates that decisive change may be delayed until the cycle completes.
 – Aspects from the Moon—such as its sextile with Pluto (orb 0°) and trines with the North Node (orb 4°) and Neptune (orb 4°)—hint at subtle emotional currents that can trigger transformation, though not forcefully.

• Action and Hesitation – Mars:
 – Mars is situated in 17° Cancer, retrograde, adding a layer of introspection and potential hesitation. Its role is mixed; while it can generate the drive for communication (especially given its sextile aspects to the MC and IC), its retrograde state indicates internal delays or ambivalence.
 – Mars’s square to Chiron (orb 3°) emphasizes a potential for wound-based responses or vulnerabilities that may interrupt direct action.

• T-Square Configuration:
 – The T-Square formed by the MC (11° Pisces), Jupiter (11° Gemini), and the IC (11° Virgo), with Mercury involved at 11° Pisces, frames a tension between public communication (MC) and personal or familial matters (IC).
 – This configuration suggests that while there is impetus for communication, competing priorities or conflicting energies (possibly linked to social and internal expectations) may slow its manifestation.

• Yod Formation:
 – The Yod, with Pluto as the apex (2° Aquarius) and the Ascendant (Melissa at 5°44′ Cancer) along with the Moon (2°44′ Sagittarius) as the supporting points, indicates a fated, if challenging, process.
 – This formation pressures the chart’s energies into a transformational course that might demand significant internal adjustments before outward expression occurs.

• Cradle Configuration:
 – The Cradle, involving Saturn (19° Pisces), the IC (11° Virgo), Mars (17° Cancer), and Uranus (23° Taurus), reflects a dynamic grouping that balances stabilization and sudden change.
 – Saturn’s sextile aspect to Uranus (orb 4°) implies that even though structures are in place, disruptive energy (particularly from Mars) can modify outcomes.

• Additional Interactions:
 – The strong Mercury–MC conjunction, in tandem with Mercury’s trines to both the Ascendant and Mars (orbs near 6°), augments the indicator of imminent communication, yet the zero orb of several aspects (e.g., Moon sextile Pluto, Sun square Moon) highlights that the energies are exactly aligned, leaving little room for ambiguity.
 – Neptune’s influence (28°35′ Pisces)—while conjoined by the North Node (0° orb)—adds an ethereal quality that may obscure precise timing but suggests that the message, when it comes, will carry weight beyond simple words.

────────────────────────────
Step 3: Consolidation of Timing Indicators

• Mercury is acting as the primary communicator. Its placement in Pisces directly upon the MC emphasizes that any messages from Stefan will likely be imbued with emotional or intuitive content rather than blunt logic.
 – Look to the activation of Mercury’s energy through its immediate transit cycles. Given Mercury’s current placement exactly conjoined to the MC, indications suggest an impulse toward communication is emerging now or very shortly.

• The last quarter Moon suggests that we are nearing the resolution of a cycle; completion of this phase often precedes decisive communication following a period of internal evaluation.

• Mars’s retrograde status implies that although the heart may be inclined, action is internally debated. The square to Chiron shows that unresolved wounds or hesitations may hold back direct expression. This factor points to some delay or internal processing before physical communication occurs.

• The T-square’s presence, with tensions centered on a pivotal degree (11°), further implies that while communication is intended, it might be impacted by ongoing conflicts between public persona (MC) and internal, personal resolve (IC).

────────────────────────────
Step 4: Summary of Methodological Extraction

• Melissa (Ascendant) stands poised in Cancer, facing emotional currents that demand clarity.
• Stefan, represented by the 9th house indicators and the presence of transformative Pluto in Aquarius, is influenced by fated and unconventional forces.
• Mercury’s precise conjunction with the MC pinpoints communication as the immediate mechanism through which Stefan’s heart might turn.
• The overall configurations (T-Square, Yod, Cradle) indicate that while the energies support a move toward communication, delays and internal hesitations persist.
• Timing remains linked to the activation of Mercury’s transit qualities and the resolution of the Moon’s waning phase, suggesting an imminent—but not instantaneous—window for communication.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a precise interpretation based on the documented horary chart data:

• Communication is centered on Mercury at 11°35′ Pisces, conjoined with the Midheaven (MC at 11°36′ Pisces). This placement strongly indicates that any message from Stefan will be communicated in an emotionally charged, intuitive manner.

• Stefan’s indicators come from the 9th house cusp (starting at 17° Aquarius) and the presence of Pluto (2°39′ Aquarius) reinforces the influence of unexpected or transformational factors. This suggests that his decision to follow the heart is linked to forces outside the norm and may involve a profound internal shift.

• The Moon in Sagittarius at 2°44′, being in its last quarter phase, marks a transitional period. This phase supports the resolution of inner conflicts; however, it also indicates that the energy is in a state of flux and requires completion of an internal cycle before definitive action occurs.

• Mars in Cancer at 17°05′ (retrograde) introduces hesitation and internal conflict into the process. Its square to Chiron (3° orb) shows that unresolved wounds or sensitivities may be holding back the full expression of Stefan’s feelings, delaying outward communication.

• The presence of a prominent T-Square (MC at 11° Pisces, Jupiter at 11° Gemini, and IC at 11° Virgo with Mercury included) signals tension between his public actions and his private emotions. This configuration means that while the inclination to communicate exists, competing internal priorities or external responsibilities (possibly linked to his broader life situation) create delays.

• The Yod formation—with Pluto as the apex, supported by the Ascendant (you at 5°44′ Cancer) and the Moon—establishes a fated but challenging dynamic that demands internal adjustment. This pressure points to a necessary period of internal calibration before Stefan’s feelings translate into clear communication.

• The strong Mercury–MC alignment combined with supportive trines (Mercury trine Ascendant and Mercury trine Mars) indicates that once the internal hesitations are resolved, the pathway to communication will notably open. The absence of softening in the aspects leaves the impression that the message will carry clear, unvarnished truth—even if it comes after a period of delay.

Timing Analysis:
– The chart emphasizes an imminent activation of Mercury’s communicative energy. However, Mars’ retrograde influence and the Moon’s transitional phase imply that the internal processing period must conclude before Stefan is able to reach out.
– The energies suggest that communication should occur once the tension represented by the T-Square and Yod has been internally resolved. This may coincide with the completion of the Moon’s phase cycle and a subsequent enhancement of Mercury’s active transit.
– On a practical scale, the chart indicates that Stefan’s decision—and consequent communication—are not instantaneous. The delay may be on the order of several days to a week after the horary question is posed, potentially aligning with the end of the current lunar phase and the commencement of a favorable Mercury transit that supports clear messaging.

Final Findings:
– The chart indicates that Stefan is inclined to eventually follow his heart, though internal conflicts (seen in Mars retrograde and the T-Square tension) postpone direct action.
– Communication is highly likely to occur once the internal and external tensions resolve, likely within a short-term window (several days to a week) after this horizon. The decisive moment ties to Mercury’s energetic activation and the completion of the Moon’s last quarter phase.

This interpretation reflects the chart’s data precisely, without softening of the negative or positive elements.
